An Early Warning Algorithm for Public Opinion of Safety Emergency
Tian ShihaiLyu Deli (School of Management, Harbin University of Science and Technology, Harbin 15o040, China)

Abstract:[Objective] This study proposes a new early warning model to track the public sentiment online,aiming to improve transparency and responding speed of the safety emergencies.[Methods] We used the modified $\mathrm { L S A ^ { + } S V M }$ ï¼ˆ204å· algorithm to build an early warning model,which retrieved publicopiniondata by meta search.[Results] We examined the new model with three diferent incidents,and found it was practical and fast.The precision rate was $8 5 . 7 5 \%$ when the semantic dimension was kept at10.[Limitations] This method was more efective forthe safety incidents drawing public atention and discussion.[Conclusions] The proposed algorithm helps us build an early warming system for public opinion, which provides suggestions to related companies and government organizations.
Keywords: Latent Semantic Analysis(LSA) Support Vector Machine(SVM) Public Opinion Early Warning Emotional Orientation Analysis
